definitions.definition: A small cavern or hollow place in the side of a hill , or among rocks ; especially, a cave used by a wild animal for shelter or concealment .
examples: Daniel was put into the lions’ den .
synonyms: Wiktionary appendix of animal terms, including their homes

definitions.definition: A squalid or wretched place; a haunt .
examples: an opium den ; a gambling den

definitions.definition: A comfortable room not used for formal entertaining .
Synonym of fort ( “ structure improvised from furniture, etc. for playing games. ” ) .
examples: Our little girls love using bedsheets and other stuff around the house to make dens in the living room and pretending they're on adventures.

definitions.definition: ( UK , Scotland , obsolete ) A narrow glen ; a ravine ; a dell .
A group of Cub Scouts of the same age who work on projects together .

main_definition: A small cavern or hollow place in the side of a hill , or among rocks ; especially, a cave used by a wild animal for shelter or concealment .
secondary_definitions: A squalid or wretched place; a haunt .
A comfortable room not used for formal entertaining .
Synonym of fort ( “ structure improvised from furniture, etc. for playing games. ” ) .
( UK , Scotland , obsolete ) A narrow glen ; a ravine ; a dell .
A group of Cub Scouts of the same age who work on projects together .

definitions.definition: Abbreviation of denier ( a unit of weight ) .

main_definition: Abbreviation of denier ( a unit of weight ) .
( Northumbria , chiefly in place names ) Alternative form of dene .
